name: Northern
description: The more northern of two similar features, or the northern-most of several similar features.

name: South Eastern
description: The more south eastern of two similar features, or the south-eastern-most of several similar features.

name: Upper
description: Where the control feature is directly above a similar feature

name: Lower
description: Where the control feature is directly below a similar feature

name: Middle
description: Where the control feature is the middle one of a number of similar features.

name: Terrace
description: A flat area or strip of level ground interrupting a slope.

name: Spur
description: A contour projection or "nose" rising from the surrounding ground.

name: Re-entrant
description: A gully or valley cutting into a slope.

name: Earth bank
description: An abrupt change in ground level which can clearly be distinguished from its surroundings.

name: Quarry
description: Gravel, sand or stone working in flat or inclined ground

name: Earth wall
description: A narrow wall of earth projecting above the surrounding terrain; may be partially stone faced, usually man-made.

name: Erosion gully
description: An erosion gully, normally dry

name: Small erosion gully
description: A small erosion gully, normally dry.

name: Hill
description: A high point. Shown on the map with contour lines.

name: Knoll
description: A small obvious mound or knoll.

name: Saddle
description: The low point between two higher points.

name: Depression
description: A depression or hollow from which the ground rises on all sides. Shown on the map with contour lines.

name: Small depression
description: A small, shallow, natural depression or hollow from which the ground rises on all sides.

name: Pit
description: A pit or hole with distinct steep-sides. Usually man-made. Used with symbol 8.6 to indicate a rocky pit.

name: Broken ground
description: Clearly disturbed ground with features too small or too numerous to be mapped individually.

name: Ant hill (termite mound)
description: A mound created by ants or termites.

name: Cliff, Crag
description: A cliff or rock face. May be passable or impassable.

name: Rock Pillar
description: A high, natural rock projection.

name: Cave
description: A hole in a rock face or hill side, which may or may not lead to underground workings.

name: Boulder
description: A prominent free-standing block of rock or stone.

name: Boulder field
description: An area covered by so many boulders that they cannot be individually mapped.

name: Boulder cluster
description: A small distinct group of boulders so closely clustered together that they cannot be individually mapped.

name: Stony ground
description: An area covered with many small stones or rocks.

name: Bare rock
description: A runnable area of rock with no earth or vegetation cover.

name: Narrow passage
description: A gap between two cliffs or rock faces that face each other.

name: Trench
description: A rocky or artificial trench.

name: Lake
description: A large area of water, normally mapped as uncrossable.

name: Pond
description: A small area of water, may be shallow or seasonal.

name: Waterhole
description: A water-filled pit or depression.

name: River, Stream
description: A natural or artificial watercourse with either moving or standing water.

name: Minor water channel, Ditch
description: A natural or man-made minor water channel which may contain water only intermittently.

name: Narrow marsh
description: A narrow marsh or trickle of water, too narrow to be shown on the map with the marsh symbol.

name: Marsh
description: A permanently wet area with marsh vegetation.

name: Firm ground in marsh
description: A non-marshy area within a marsh, or between two marshes.

name: Well
description: A shaft containing water or a captive spring, clearly visible on the ground. Often with some form of man-made surround.

name: Spring
description: The source of a watercourse with a distinct outflow.

name: Water tank
description: A man-made water container.

name: Open land
description: An area with no trees. Grassland, a meadow or a field. Also heath or moorland. Used with symbol 8.8 to indicate open sandy ground.

name: Semi-open land
description: An area of open land with scattered trees or bushes.

name: Forest corner
description: The corner or tip of a forested area projecting into open land.

name: Clearing
description: A small area of land free from trees within the forest.

name: Thicket
description: A small area of forest where the tree cover or undergrowth is so dense that it is difficult to pass. May also be used for an individual bush.

name: Linear thicket
description: A man-made line of trees or bushes that is difficult to cross. May also be used for a hedge.

name: Vegetation boundary
description: A distinct boundary between different types of trees or vegetation.

name: Copse
description: A small area of trees in open ground or a more runnable area of trees surrounded by thicker forest.

name: Prominent tree
description: An unusual or prominent tree in either open land or forest; frequently information is also given as to its type

name: Prominent vegetation feature e.g. root stock, tree stump
description: The upturned root of a fallen tree, with or without the trunk. The stump of a tree.

name: Road
description: A metalled/asphalt surfaced or dirt road, suitable for vehicles in normal weather conditions.

name: Track / Path
description: A visible route made by people or animals. Tracks may be driven by rugged vehicles.

name: Ride
description: A forest ride or a prominent trace through the terrain which does not have a distinct runnable path along it.

name: Bridge
description: A crossing point over a watercourse or other linear feature.

name: Power line
description: A power or telephone line, cableway or ski lift.

name: Pylon
description: A support for power or telephone line, cableway or ski lift.

name: Tunnel
description: A way under roads, railways, etc.

name: Wall
description: A wall of stone or other materials. Used with symbol 8.11 to indicate a ruined wall.

name: Fence
description: A wire or wooden boundary. Used with symbol 8.11 to indicate a ruined fence.

name: Crossing point
description: A way through or over a wall, fence, or other linear feature, including a gate or stile.

name: Building
description: A man-made structure. Typically of brick, wood or stone. A pillar supporting a roof.

name: Paved area
description: An area of hard standing used for parking or other purposes.

name: Ruin
description: The remains of a building that has fallen down.

name: Prominent man-made line feature. e.g. pipeline; bobsleigh/ skeleton track.
description: A prominent line feature such as a pipeline (gas, water, oil, etc.) or a bobsleigh/ skeleton track which is above ground level.

name: Tower / Pylon
description: A tower. Typically of metal, brick or wood.

name: Shooting platform
description: A structure attached to a tree where a marksman or observer can sit.

name: Boundary stone, Cairn
description: A man-made stone or pile of stones. A cairn, memorial stone, boundary stone or trigonometric point.

name: Fodder rack
description: A construction for holding feed for animals.

name: Charcoal burning ground, Platform
description: The clear remains of an area where charcoal was burned. A small level man-made area on a slope (a platform).

name: Monument or Statue
description: A monument, memorial or statue.

name: Canopy
description: An accessible area with a roof. A canopy or a covered passageway through a building.

name: Stairway
description: A stairway of at least two steps.

name: Out of Bounds area
description: Out of Bounds area. Typically a flower bed or similar feature.

name: Railway
description: A railway, tramway, or other kind of railed track.

name: Prominent feature / Special item
description: If used, an explanation of its meaning or meanings must be supplied to competitors in the pre-race information.

name: Prominent feature / Special item
description: If used, an explanation of its meaning or meanings must be supplied to competitors in the pre-race information.

name: Low
description: Where the control feature is particularly low or flat but this is not indicated on the map; e.g. Hill, low

name: Shallow
description: Where the control feature is particularly shallow but this is not indicated on the map; e.g. Re-entrant, shallow.

name: Deep
description: Where the control feature is particularly deep but this is not indicated on the map; e.g. Pit, deep.

name: Overgrown
description: Where the feature is partially covered in undergrowth or bushes that are not indicated on the map; e.g. Ruin, overgrown.

name: Open
description: Where the feature is in an area where the tree cover is less than the surroundings but this is not indicated on the map; e.g. Marsh, open.

name: Rocky, Stony
description: Where the feature is in an area of rocky or stony ground not indicated on the map; e.g. Knoll, rocky. Also used in conjunction with symbol 1.14 to indicate a rocky pit (ISOM 203).

name: Marshy
description: Where the feature is in an area of marshy ground not indicated on the map; e.g. Re-entrant, marshy

name: Sandy
description: Where the feature is in an area of sandy ground not indicated on the map; e.g. Depression, sandy. Also used in conjunction with symbol 4.1 to indicate sandy ground (ISOM 213).

name: Needle leaved
description: Where the tree or trees associated with the control feature have needle shaped leaves; e.g. Prominent tree, needle leaved.

name: Broad leaved
description: Where the tree or trees associated with the control feature are broad-leaved; e.g. Copse, broad leaved.

name: Ruined
description: Where the feature has fallen to ground level; e.g. Fence, ruined.

name: Crossing
description: The point at which two linear features cross.

name: Junction
description: The point at which two linear features meet; or where a linear feature meets the side or edge of an areal feature.

name: Bend
description: Used where a linear feature makes a smooth change of direction; e.g. Path bend; River bend.

name: North east side
description: Used where the feature extends above the surface of the ground; e.g. Boulder, north east side; Ruin, west side. A control on the side of a feature will not usually be visible from the opposite side.

name: South east edge
description: Used where the feature extends down from the surrounding ground and the control is situated on the edge at ground level; or where the feature extends over a significant area and the control is situated on the border of that area.

name: West part
description: Used where the feature extends over a significant area and the control is located neither at the centre, nor on any of the edges.

name: East corner (inside)
description: Used where the edge of a feature turns through an angle of 45-135 degrees or a linear feature turns a corner.

name: South corner (outside)
description: Similar to East Corner (inside) but for the outside of the feature.

name: South west tip
description: Used where the edge of a feature turns through an angle of less than 45 degrees; e.g. Marsh, south west tip.

name: North west end
description: The point at which a linear feature ends or starts; e.g. Ride, north west end; Stone wall, south end.

name: Upper part
description: Where the feature extends over two or more contours and the control is located near the top; e.g. Erosion Gully, upper part.

name: Lower part
description: Where the feature extends over two or more contours  and the control is located near the bottom; e.g. Re- entrant, lower part.

name: Top
description: Where the control is located at the highest point of the feature and this is not the default location; e.g. Cliff, top; Stairway, top. The Upper of two levels.

name: Foot (no direction)
description: Where the control is located at the lower junction of the slope of the feature and the surface of the surrounding area and this is not the default location; e.g. Earth bank, foot; Stairway, foot.

name: North east foot
description: As above, but where the feature is large enough for the control to be placed in more than one location around it; e.g. Hill, north east foot.

name: Beneath
description: Where the control is located underneath the feature. Also indicates the lower of two levels.

name: Between
description: Where the control is located between two features. e.g. Between thickets; Between boulder and knoll.

name: First Aid post
description: Control site where First Aid is available.

name: Refreshment point
description: Control site where Refreshments are available.

name: Manned control
description: Manned control site.
